results.title: The First pollution
results.brief_description: Reports on current efforts to clean up soources of water supply in America and potential solutions to the problem of water pollution. Comparative footage of two major rivers shows the results of an expanding program of waste treatment. Illustrates industry’s role in controlling and reducing pollution hazards. Visits the waste treatment plant at Lake Tahoe.

results.title: Film graphics: abstract aspect of editing
results.creator_credit: Barry Spinello, Paul Aratow and Cine Qua Non-Bartholomus
results.brief_description: With pictures, animation and quotations from classical cinema, this film shows some of the basic structural principles of film composition and editing. Extracts from BATTLESHIP POTEMKIN, UN CHIEN ANDALOU, and MAN WITH A MOVIE CAMERA, show the use of abstract graphic structure in film editing.

results.title: A Film for projection
results.brief_description: A short film with narration showing all the do’s and dont’s of film projection and film handling. Written by John Thompson, edited by Norman l. Ziegler, photographed by George D. Hobbs and narrated by Charles Cousens.

results.title: A Film about film making
results.creator_credit: Henry Cheharbakshi and International Film Bureau Inc
results.brief_description: An explanation about how a group of people make a film. From the idea, we see the process of choosing cast and crew, writing of the synopsis giving setting, characters of the story, clothes, props and action. The formation of a shooting script is seen, and planning of action. Finally the film is shot, edited and shown.

results.title: A Fight for breath: emphysema
results.creator_credit: Joe Licastro, Floyd Elliott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film aimed at youngsters tempted by cigarettes but also for all those already addicted. Why a man suffering from emphysema has difficulty breathing is graphically illustrated. The entire respiratory system is shown in animated cross-sectional models, down to the smallest air cells, the alveoli. That is where the breakdown begins that eventually leads to impaired pulmonary function. This internal view of the damage done to the lungs is one that no viewer can ignore.

results.title: A Field in Asia
results.creator_credit: George Wickremesinghe, Jehangir Bhownagary, Ceylon Government Film Unit and United Nations
results.brief_description: Agricultural extension officers of F.A.O. encourage Asian farmers to use better methods to increase harvests. An example in Ceylon shows use of better seed and improved sowing, cultivating and fertilising. Original music by Ravi Shankar.

results.title: Festival in Adelaide
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, Loch Townsend, Malcolm Otton, Richard Mason, Maslyn Williams, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows something of the preparation that went into the Adelaide Festival of Arts 1962, and excerpts from the performances themselves. General notes: AFI Award: silver award (documentary) 1963.

results.title: Festival Casals 1970: Pablo Casals conducting
results.creator_credit: Ken Sale and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: Spanish born cellist Pablo casals is filmed here conducting a rehearsal of Beethoven’s 7th Symphony in preparation for the annual Casals Festival at San Juan, Puerto Rico. The film concentrates on the 94 year old Casals’ gestures and speech as he conducts, and interrupts to correct the playing of the orchestra during the opening to the first movement.
